trans-unit.source: Managing Azure resources with Cloud Explorer
trans-unit.target: Managing Azure resources with Cloud Explorer

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Cloud Explorer to browse and manage Azure resources within Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Cloud Explorer to browse and manage Azure resources within Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Managing Azure resources with Cloud Explorer
trans-unit.target: Managing Azure resources with Cloud Explorer

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Cloud Explorer is designed to let you more easily and quickly browse and manage your Azure resources within the Visual Studio IDE.
trans-unit.target: Cloud Explorer is designed to let you more easily and quickly browse and manage your Azure resources within the Visual Studio IDE.

trans-unit.source: You can, for example, use it to open a Web app in the Azure portal or in a browser, or attach a debugger to it, or you can view the properties of a blob container and open it in the Blob Container Editor.
trans-unit.target: You can, for example, use it to open a Web app in the Azure portal or in a browser, or attach a debugger to it, or you can view the properties of a blob container and open it in the Blob Container Editor.

trans-unit.source: Cloud Explorer is built on the Azure resource manager stack, just like the Microsoft Azure Preview portal.
trans-unit.target: Cloud Explorer is built on the Azure resource manager stack, just like the Microsoft Azure Preview portal.

trans-unit.source: It understands resources such as Azure resource groups and Azure services such as Logic apps and API apps, and it supports [role-based access control](../role-based-access-control-configure/) (RBAC).
trans-unit.target: It understands resources such as Azure resource groups and Azure services such as Logic apps and API apps, and it supports [role-based access control](../role-based-access-control-configure/) (RBAC).

trans-unit.source: To see Azure resources that have been added or changed, choose the **Refresh** button on the Cloud Explorer toolbar.
trans-unit.target: To see Azure resources that have been added or changed, choose the **Refresh** button on the Cloud Explorer toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Cloud Explorer is installed as part of the Visual Studio Tools for Azure SDK 2.7.
trans-unit.target: Cloud Explorer is installed as part of the Visual Studio Tools for Azure SDK 2.7.

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: Visual Studio 2015 RTM.
trans-unit.target: Visual Studio 2015 RTM.

trans-unit.source: The Visual Studio Tools for Azure SDK.
trans-unit.target: The Visual Studio Tools for Azure SDK.

trans-unit.source: You must also have an Azure account and be logged into it to view Azure resources in Cloud Explorer.
trans-unit.target: You must also have an Azure account and be logged into it to view Azure resources in Cloud Explorer.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have one, you can create an account in just a couple of minutes.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have one, you can create an account in just a couple of minutes.

trans-unit.source: If you have an MSDN subscription, see [Azure Benefit for MSDN Subscribers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/).
trans-unit.target: If you have an MSDN subscription, see [Azure Benefit for MSDN Subscribers](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/member-offers/msdn-benefits-details/).

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, see [create a free trial account](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, see [create a free trial account](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/).

trans-unit.source: If Cloud Explorer isn't visible, you can view it by choosing **View**, **Other Windows,** **Cloud Explorer** on the menu bar.
trans-unit.target: If Cloud Explorer isn't visible, you can view it by choosing **View**, **Other Windows,** **Cloud Explorer** on the menu bar.

trans-unit.source: Manage Azure accounts and subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Manage Azure accounts and subscriptions

trans-unit.source: To see your Azure resources in Cloud Explorer, you need to log in to an Azure account with one or more active subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: To see your Azure resources in Cloud Explorer, you need to log in to an Azure account with one or more active subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: If you have more than one Azure account, you can add them in Cloud Explorer and then choose the subscriptions you want to include in the Cloud Explorer resource view.
trans-unit.target: If you have more than one Azure account, you can add them in Cloud Explorer and then choose the subscriptions you want to include in the Cloud Explorer resource view.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't used Azure before, or you haven't added the necessary accounts to Visual Studio, you'll be prompted to do so.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't used Azure before, or you haven't added the necessary accounts to Visual Studio, you'll be prompted to do so.

trans-unit.source: To add Azure accounts to Cloud Explorer
trans-unit.target: To add Azure accounts to Cloud Explorer

trans-unit.source: Choose the Settings icon on the Cloud Explorer toolbar.
trans-unit.target: Choose the Settings icon on the Cloud Explorer toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Choose the **Add an account** link.
trans-unit.target: Choose the **Add an account** link.

trans-unit.source: Log into the Azure account whose resources you want to browse.
trans-unit.target: Log into the Azure account whose resources you want to browse.

trans-unit.source: The account you just added should be selected in the account picker dropdown list.
trans-unit.target: The account you just added should be selected in the account picker dropdown list.

trans-unit.source: The subscriptions for that account appear under the account entry.
trans-unit.target: The subscriptions for that account appear under the account entry.

trans-unit.source: Adding Azure subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Adding Azure subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Choosing Azure subscriptions
trans-unit.target: Choosing Azure subscriptions

trans-unit.source: Select the check boxes for the account subscriptions you want to browse and then choose the **Apply** button.
trans-unit.target: Select the check boxes for the account subscriptions you want to browse and then choose the **Apply** button.

trans-unit.source: The Azure resources for the selected subscriptions appear in Cloud Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The Azure resources for the selected subscriptions appear in Cloud Explorer.

trans-unit.source: To remove an Azure account
trans-unit.target: To remove an Azure account

trans-unit.source: Choose **File**, **Account Settings** on the menu bar.
trans-unit.target: Choose **File**, **Account Settings** on the menu bar.

trans-unit.source: In the **All Accounts** section of the **Account Settings** dialog box, choose the **Remove** command next to the account you want to remove.
trans-unit.target: In the **All Accounts** section of the **Account Settings** dialog box, choose the **Remove** command next to the account you want to remove.

trans-unit.source: Note that this command only removes the account from Visual Studio–it doesn't affect the Azure account itself.
trans-unit.target: Note that this command only removes the account from Visual Studio–it doesn't affect the Azure account itself.

trans-unit.source: View resource types or groups
trans-unit.target: View resource types or groups

trans-unit.source: To view your Azure resources, you can choose either **Resource Types** or **Resource Groups** view.
trans-unit.target: To view your Azure resources, you can choose either **Resource Types** or **Resource Groups** view.

trans-unit.source: Resource view dropdown
trans-unit.target: Resource view dropdown

trans-unit.source: **Resource Types** view, which is also the common view used on the Azure portal, shows your Azure resources categorized by their type, such as web apps, storage accounts and virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: **Resource Types** view, which is also the common view used on the Azure portal, shows your Azure resources categorized by their type, such as web apps, storage accounts and virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: This is similar to how Azure resources appear in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: This is similar to how Azure resources appear in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Resource Groups view categorizes Azure resources by the Azure resource group they're associated with.
trans-unit.target: Resource Groups view categorizes Azure resources by the Azure resource group they're associated with.

trans-unit.source: View and navigate resources
trans-unit.target: View and navigate resources

trans-unit.source: To navigate to an Azure resource and view its information in Cloud Explorer, expand the item's type or associated resource group and then choose the resource.
trans-unit.target: To navigate to an Azure resource and view its information in Cloud Explorer, expand the item's type or associated resource group and then choose the resource.

trans-unit.source: When you choose a resource, information appears in the two tabs at the bottom of Cloud Explorer.
trans-unit.target: When you choose a resource, information appears in the two tabs at the bottom of Cloud Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Choose a resource view
trans-unit.target: Choose a resource view

trans-unit.source: The **Actions** tab shows the actions you can take in Cloud Explorer for the selected resource.
trans-unit.target: The **Actions** tab shows the actions you can take in Cloud Explorer for the selected resource.

trans-unit.source: You can also see available actions on the shortcut menu of the resource.
trans-unit.target: You can also see available actions on the shortcut menu of the resource.

trans-unit.source: The **Properties** tab shows the properties of the resource, such as its type, locale and resource group it's associated with.
trans-unit.target: The **Properties** tab shows the properties of the resource, such as its type, locale and resource group it's associated with.

trans-unit.source: Every resource has the action **Open in portal**.
trans-unit.target: Every resource has the action **Open in portal**.

trans-unit.source: When you choose this action, Cloud Explorer displays the selected resource in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: When you choose this action, Cloud Explorer displays the selected resource in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: This feature is particularly handy for navigating to deeply-nested resources.
trans-unit.target: This feature is particularly handy for navigating to deeply-nested resources.

trans-unit.source: Additional actions and property values may also appear based on the Azure resource.
trans-unit.target: Additional actions and property values may also appear based on the Azure resource.

trans-unit.source: For example, web apps and logic apps also have the actions **Open in browser** and **Attach debugger** in addition to **Open in portal**.
trans-unit.target: For example, web apps and logic apps also have the actions **Open in browser** and **Attach debugger** in addition to **Open in portal**.

trans-unit.source: Actions to open editors appear when you choose a storage account blob, queue, or table.
trans-unit.target: Actions to open editors appear when you choose a storage account blob, queue, or table.

trans-unit.source: Azure apps have **URL** and **Status** properties, while storage resources have key and connection string properties.
trans-unit.target: Azure apps have **URL** and **Status** properties, while storage resources have key and connection string properties.

trans-unit.source: Search resources
trans-unit.target: Search resources

trans-unit.source: To locate resources with a specific name in your Azure account subscriptions, enter the name in the Search box in Cloud Explorer.
trans-unit.target: To locate resources with a specific name in your Azure account subscriptions, enter the name in the Search box in Cloud Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Finding resources in Cloud Explorer
trans-unit.target: Finding resources in Cloud Explorer

trans-unit.source: As you enter characters in the Search box, only resources that match those characters appear in the resource tree.
trans-unit.target: As you enter characters in the Search box, only resources that match those characters appear in the resource tree.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
